Dating: ROMAN PERIOD (not before); BYZANTINE PERIOD ?; BYZANTINE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Decorative Band
Description: The scenes on this decorative band of carpetwork in wool and linen come from Greek mythology, in particular the cycle of Dionysos, the god of wine. There are four pairs of dancers, sileni and maenads (?), each separated by a round medallion in which a small musician is riding a leopard. The piece dates to the 5th - 6th century AD.
